item.name: Unhandled Python exception simulation (modify server route to raise Exception)

description.content: To validate global exception handling temporarily modify server to raise an exception for this route. Expect 500 and a JSON error.

exec: pm.test('Expect 500 when server raises unhandled exception', function(){ pm.expect([500,502,503]).to.include(pm.response.code); });
pm.test('Response contains JSON error field', function(){ try{ var j=pm.response.json(); pm.expect(j).to.have.property('error'); } catch(e) { pm.expect.fail('Response not JSON with error'); } });

item.name: JSON decoding error - send malformed JSON

description.content: Sends malformed JSON. Server should return an error (400 or 500) handled globally.

exec: pm.test('Expect 4xx or 5xx for malformed JSON', function(){ pm.expect(pm.response.code).to.be.above(399); });

pm.test('Response mentions JSON parse or error', function(){ var txt = pm.response.text().toLowerCase(); pm.expect(txt).to.satisfy(function(s){ return s.includes('json') || s.includes('parse') || s.includes('error'); }); });

description.content: Hit a missing route. Expect 404 and JSON error message or HTML 404 depending on app configuration.

exec: pm.test('If JSON returned it should contain error key', function(){ try{ var j=pm.response.json(); pm.expect(j).to.have.property('error'); } catch(e){ pm.test('Response not JSON - likely HTML 404', function(){ pm.expect(pm.response.code).to.equal(404); }); } });

description.content: PATCH is not allowed on /create; expect 405 Method Not Allowed or 404 depending on Flask configuration.

exec: pm.test('Expect 405 or 404 for invalid method', function(){ pm.expect([404,405]).to.include(pm.response.code); });
